text: - I'm Hazif Abdoul Gaffour,
manager of DevOps team in Aldebaran.
In Aldebaran, we build robots.

We had to build very
quickly a cloud platform,
which is working at the edge.
We choose AWS
because we felt that there was a maturity
in terms of robotics.
We implemented the cloud infrastructure

enabling a deployment at
the edge using IoT core,
and at the edge,
we're using Greengrass service.

Using AWS help us building
quickly a solution
for our robots in a secure way,
which is scalable.

There are some cool features
enabled by the cloud,
like remotely operate the robots,

do some remote investigation,
remote maintenance,

and being able to collect
data of the robots
so that you can have some knowledge

of how the robot is used,
how you can improve it.

Also, being able to do
some predictive maintenance
on the robots
and being able to see any failure

before the client calls the
customer care, for example.
The connectivity is very key in robotics

because it enables to
connect to other devices,
and it's very important

that the communication must
be secure between them.

The more data we get, the better
we can improve our robots.

So, that's very important
and key for us to have data

and to be able to bring value
to the robots and improve it.

Using AWS allow us to use
state-of-the-art services
that enables data analysis quickly

and that can help us improve
the customer satisfaction.
(bright upbeat music)
